item.description: A court filing said the bond was provided by Knight Insurance, a California-based company. The move ensures that New York Attorney General Letitia James can't seize Trump's assets related to the case.

item.title: Iranian officials accuse Israel of a deadly attack on Iran's consulate in Syria
item.description: An Israeli airstrike on Iran's consulate in Damascus killed two Iranian generals and five others, Iranian state media said Monday. Israel has not yet commented on the attack.

item.title: White House hosts a soggy, education-themed Easter egg roll
item.description: It's one of the few days of the year where the executive branch becomes a child's playground — and this year, the White House Easter Egg Roll drew kids to the South Lawn despite some light rain.

item.title: Israelis Return to a City that was Attacked
item.description:
Sderot, Israel, near the border with Gaza, was the biggest city attack by Hamas on October 7th. At the beginning of the war, Israel evacuated nearly everyone. Our correspondent visits Sderot and finds that people are returning.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

item.title: Trump's social media stock tumbles, erasing early gains
item.description: Stock in the parent company of former president Donald Trump's social media platform sank on Monday, after the company reported losing $58 million last year. That erased last week's market gains.

item.title: United asks pilots to take unpaid leave in May because of delivery delays at Boeing
item.description: United Airlines says it's trying to reduce pilot staffing levels next month because it's not receiving as many new 737 Max planes as expected, the latest fallout from manufacturing problems at Boeing.

item.title: Why Oregon schools' pandemic recovery lags behind much of the nation
item.description: Oregon schools are struggling more than others across the country to recover academic learning losses. Experts say one likely reason is a lack of statewide consistency in tutoring interventions.

item.title: 'I was broken and needed help': After her father died, a stranger stepped in
item.description: When Roxanne Olson found herself in the middle of a security scare at Chicago's O'Hare airport, a woman walked up to her and said: "I'm here to help people like you."
